api/B1PP.Database.Attributes.html.title: Namespace B1PP.Database.Attributes | B1 Plus Plus Documentation
api/B1PP.Database.Attributes.html.keywords: Namespace B1PP.Database.Attributes Classes ApproveServiceAttribute Activates the user defined object service "Approve". ChildUserTableAttribute Marks a member as being a relationship to a child table. ExcludeFindColumnAttribute Skips marked members as being FindColumns on a user defined object. FieldNameAttribute Sets the name and description of a user field. UserFieldAttribute Marks a property or field as a user field. UserFieldDefaultValueAttribute Defines the default value to use for a UserField. UserFieldEnumValuesAttribute Allows using an enumeration type as the list of valid values for a user field. UserFieldOptionalAttribute Allows marking of a field as being optional (nullable on the database). UserFieldValidValueAttribute UserObjectAttribute Marks a type as being linked with a User Defined Object. UserObjectServicesAttribute UserTableAttribute Enums ObjectServices Services provided by the User Defined Object.

articles/intro.html.keywords: Getting started What is B1PP? B1PP is a set of libraries that can be used together or independently to create SAP Business One add-ons.

guide/diapi-settings-file-format.html.title: DI API settings file format | B1 Plus Plus Documentation
guide/diapi-settings-file-format.html.keywords: DI API settings file format Here is the standard file format for the DI API settings. <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?> <DiApiConnectionSettings> <Server></Server> <UseTrusted></UseTrusted> <UserName></UserName> <Password></Password> <Language></Language> <LicenseServer></LicenseServer> <DbServerType></DbServerType> <CompanyDb></CompanyDb> <DbUserName></DbUserName> <DbPassword></DbPassword> </DiApiConnectionSettings> Server This should be filled with the name or IP of your server. <Server>localhost</Server> Use Trusted This defines whether you'll be using trusted connection or a regular connection. Accepted values are 1 for True and 0 for false. UserName This is the username you use to connect to the company. <UserName>manager</UserName> Password This is the password for the username provided. Language The language to use for this session. Accepted values are the enum literals of BoSuppLang. <Language>ln_English</Language> UserName This is the username you use to connect to the company. <UserName>manager</UserName> Password This is the password for the username provided. License server The address of the license server. The format must be provided like "server:port". <LicenseServer>localhost:30000</LicenseServer> DbServerType The type of the database server. Accepted values are the enum literals of the BoDataServerTypes. <DbServerType>dst_MSSQL2012</DbServerType> CompanyDb The name of the company database. <CompanyDb>SBODEMOUS</CompanyDb> DbUserName This is the username you use to connect to your database server. <DbUserName>sa</DbUserName> DbPassword This is the password for the database username provided.

samples/diapi-connection.html.title: DI API connection sample | B1 Plus Plus Documentation
samples/diapi-connection.html.keywords: DI API connection sample In this sample we will show you how to perform a connection to the DI API using B1PP. string settingsFilePath = args[0]; DiApiConnectionSettings settings = DiApiConnectionSettings.Load(settingsFilePath); IConnection diapi = ConnectionFactory.CreateDiApiConnection(settings); diapi.Connect(); // something useful is done here diapi.Disconnect();

samples/index.html.title: Samples | B1 Plus Plus Documentation
samples/index.html.keywords: Samples Here you can find code samples to help you understand the usage of the libraries.

samples/standard-connection.html.title: Standard connection sample | B1 Plus Plus Documentation
samples/standard-connection.html.keywords: Standard connection sample In this sample, we will show you how to perform a standard connection to SAP Business One (UI and DI API). We assume that you are comfortable with Visual Studio and NuGet. Pre-requisites Visual Studio and NuGet Windows Forms project B1PP.Connections installed using Install-Package B1PP.Connections -Pre Code namespace StandardConnectionSample { using System; using System.Windows.Forms; using B1PP.Connections; internal static class Program { /// <summary> /// The main entry point for the application. /// </summary> [STAThread] private static void Main() { IConnection connection = ConnectionFactory.CreateStandardConnection(); try { connection.Connect(); connection.Application.MessageBox($@"Hello {connection.Application.Company.Name} ! "); } catch (ConnectionException e) { System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show(e.Message, @"Error", MessageBoxButtons.OK); } finally { connection.Disconnect(); } } } }

api/B1PP.DI.Schema.Attributes.ObjectServ.keywords: Enum ObjectServices Services provided by the User Defined Object. Namespace :B1PP.DI.Schema.Attributes Assembly :B1PP.DI.Schema.dll Syntax public enum ObjectServices Fields Name Description Cancel The cancel service allows marking of a record as canceled. Close The close service allows marking of a record as closed. Default Default selection of services (Find and Delete). Delete The delete service allows removal of records. Find The find service allows to find records. Log The log service allows auditing of changes to records. ManageSeries The manage series service allows series to be managed within SAP Business One. YearTransfer The year transfer service allows year transfer copying.

api/B1PP.Data.html.keywords: Namespace B1PP.Data Classes DateTimeValueArg Represents a query parameter of DateTime type. DoubleValueArg Represents a query parameter of type double. IntegerValueArg Represents a query parameter of type int. MultipleDateTimeValuesArg Represents multiple date time values that can be used as parameters for a query. Query Facilitates the querying operations by acting as a simple facade. It also allows a fluent usage. var q = new Query(company); q.SetStatement(sql).With("parameter", "value); QueryArgBase Base query argument. QueryHelper Performs data access operations. StringValueArg Represents a query parameter of type string. Interfaces IColumn Stores information about a column. IQueryArg Represents a query parameter composed of a placeholder, which will be replaced by the value on the query statement. IRecordsetReader Allows reading of a recordset object contents. Delegates QueryHelper.InstanceCreator<T>

api/B1PP.Database.Attributes.ObjectServi.keywords: Enum ObjectServices Services provided by the User Defined Object. Namespace :B1PP.Database.Attributes Assembly :B1PP.Framework.dll Syntax public enum ObjectServices Fields Name Description Cancel The cancel service allows marking of a record as canceled. Close The close service allows marking of a record as closed. Default Default selection of services (Find and Delete). Delete The delete service allows removal of records. Find The find service allows to find records. Log The log service allows auditing of changes to records. ManageSeries The manage series service allows series to be managed within SAP Business One. YearTransfer The year transfer service allows year transfer copying.
